p: Clinically it is important to explore mental health in relation to sexuality and sexual health for several reasons. Firstly, McCann et al. ( 14) systematic review highlighted that sexuality and sexual health cannot be achieved and maintained without respect for, and protection of, certain human rights. The fulfillment of sexuality and sexual health is tied to the extent to which human rights are respected, protected, and fulfilled and sexual rights are already recognized in international and regional human rights documents ( 1). Secondly, clinicians are generally unaware of the potential impact on sexual function of many mental health conditions ( 15). There is a bi-directional impact of mental health on sexual health; one's mental health affects one's sexual health, and one's sexual health affects one's mental health ( 16). This is particularly important given the young ages at which mental health problems tend to emerge and develop.
